hero.title: The AI Behind
hero.subtitle: blipee
hero.description: Not just another ESG platform. blipee is your autonomous AI team that works 24/7 to manage, optimize, and improve your sustainability performance.
hero.mainDescription: Where AI meets sustainability with a touch of magic ‚ú® The revolution isn't coming‚Äîit's here, and it speaks your language. Welcome to the future where saving the planet feels like chatting with your smartest friend.

hero.badge: 8 AI Agents Working 24/7 for Your Sustainability Goals
hero.title: Stop Managing Sustainability.
hero.description: While your competitors hire consultants and build spreadsheets, you get an entire AI workforce that never sleeps. 8 autonomous agents analyzing data, predicting risks, finding savings, and ensuring compliance ‚Äî automatically.

problem.description: You're drowning in data from 15+ emission categories. Compliance frameworks change monthly. Energy patterns hide in thousands of data points. Suppliers go unmonitored. By the time you spot a problem, it's already cost you thousands ‚Äî or worse, your reputation.

autonomousOps.title: Autonomous AI Operations
autonomousOps.description: Every workflow orchestrated by agents tuned for ESG. They prioritise initiatives and keep the board informed without manual effort.

realTimeVision.title: Real-time Sustainability Vision
realTimeVision.description: Computer vision across facilities and assets identifies anomalies instantly, grounding insights in real-world behaviour.

predictiveIntelligence.title: Predictive Intelligence Everywhere
predictiveIntelligence.description: Forecast energy, water, waste, and carbon impacts 12 months ahead with 98.5% accuracy. Agents act before issues escalate.

chiefOfStaff.name: ESG Chief of Staff
chiefOfStaff.description: Strategic oversight across all sustainability operations. Coordinates agent activities, prioritizes initiatives, and delivers board-ready insights.

complianceGuardian.name: Compliance Guardian
complianceGuardian.description: Monitors 7+ frameworks (GHG, GRI, ESRS, TCFD). Auto-generates reports, flags risks before audits, and keeps you perpetually compliant.

carbonHunter.name: Carbon Hunter
carbonHunter.description: Hunts carbon reduction opportunities across all scopes. Identifies quick wins, tracks progress, and optimizes energy usage in real-time.

supplyChainInvestigator.name: Supply Chain Investigator
supplyChainInvestigator.description: Continuous supplier due diligence and risk assessment. Flags ESG violations before they become liabilities.

costSavingFinder.name: Cost Saving Finder
costSavingFinder.description: Discovers hidden savings in energy bills, waste management, and operations. Average client saves 18% in year one.

predictiveMaintenance.name: Predictive Maintenance
predictiveMaintenance.description: Predicts equipment failures weeks in advance. Schedules maintenance during optimal windows, preventing costly downtime.

autonomousOptimizer.name: Autonomous Optimizer
autonomousOptimizer.description: Continuously optimizes operations for maximum efficiency. Auto-adjusts systems based on patterns invisible to humans.

regulatoryForesight.name: Regulatory Foresight
regulatoryForesight.description: Monitors regulatory changes globally. Prepares you for new requirements months before they take effect.

assistant.title: blipee
assistant.description: Conversational AI that orchestrates your 8-agent workforce. Ask anything, get summarized answers, and keep every stakeholder aligned.

features.plainLanguage: Plain-language answers grounded in your ESG data
features.autoRouting: Routes every request to the right specialist automatically
features.proactiveBriefs: Delivers proactive briefs, alerts, and next steps
features.retainsContext: Retains context across teams and past conversations

hero.title: About
hero.description: We're building the world's first Autonomous Sustainability Intelligence platform that transforms traditional dashboard-based ESG management into conversational AI that works 24/7 as your digital sustainability team. Our mission is to create not just software, but AI employees that autonomously manage, optimize, and improve sustainability performance across any industry.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.description: A world where every organization has access to intelligent, autonomous sustainability management‚Äîwhere environmental stewardship is not a burden but an empowering, data-driven advantage. We envision a future where AI employees work alongside human teams to make sustainability decisions in real-time, turning compliance into competitive advantage and environmental responsibility into business growth.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: To democratize sustainability intelligence by building AI systems that eliminate the complexity, cost, and expertise barriers that prevent organizations from achieving their environmental goals. We exist to make sustainability management accessible to every organization‚Äîfrom startups to enterprises‚Äîby providing autonomous AI employees that understand, predict, and optimize environmental performance without requiring specialized knowledge or massive resources.

values.title: Our Values
values.subtitle: The principles that guide how we work, make decisions, and build our culture

relentlessInnovation.title: Relentless Innovation
relentlessInnovation.description: We believe in pushing boundaries and challenging the status quo. Every day we ask: how can we make sustainability management 10x better, not just incrementally improved?

customerObsession.title: Customer Obsession
customerObsession.description: Our customers' success is our success. We listen deeply, iterate rapidly, and won't rest until sustainability teams feel empowered rather than overwhelmed by their tools

transparencyTrust.title: Transparency & Trust
transparencyTrust.description: We build with openness‚Äîtransparent about our AI decisions, our data usage, and our company progress. Trust is earned through consistent actions, not promises

globalImpactMindset.title: Global Impact Mindset
globalImpactMindset.description: Every feature we build, every decision we make is evaluated through the lens of global environmental impact. We're not just building software; we're fighting climate change

qualityOverSpeed.title: Quality Over Speed
qualityOverSpeed.description: We move fast but never compromise on quality. Our AI must be reliable, our data accurate, and our insights actionable‚Äîbecause sustainability decisions matter too much to get wrong

diversePerspectives.title: Diverse Perspectives
diversePerspectives.description: The climate crisis affects everyone differently. We build an inclusive team with varied backgrounds because diverse perspectives lead to better solutions for a global challenge

scheduleDemo.title: Schedule a Demo
scheduleDemo.description: Get in touch with our team to see blipee in action

hero.badge: Every Industry. Every Organization. Every Goal.
hero.description: blipee works with any organization, in any industry, of any size. From startups to Fortune 500s, from manufacturing to services, we make sustainability simple and achievable for everyone.

coverage.title: Your Industry Is Covered
coverage.description: Sustainability challenges are universal. Whether you're tracking emissions, managing energy, reducing waste, or reporting ESG metrics, blipee adapts to your specific industry requirements and regulations.

anySector.title: Any Sector
anySector.description: From heavy industry to digital services, our AI understands your unique sustainability challenges.

anyStandard.title: Any Standard
anyStandard.description: GRI, SASB, TCFD, CSRD, EU Taxonomy - we support all major sustainability frameworks and regulations.

anySize.title: Any Size
anySize.description: From small businesses to multinational corporations, our platform scales with your needs.

intelligence.title: Industry Intelligence
intelligence.subtitle: How We Organize Industries
intelligence.description: These are just examples. If your industry isn't listed, we still work with you. Our AI adapts to any sustainability challenge.

dashboard.intensityExplanation: Emissions intensity measures your organization's carbon efficiency, showing how many tonnes of CO2 are emitted per full-time equivalent (FTE) employee.
dashboard.targetProgressExplanation: This card shows how many of your sustainability targets are on track to be achieved. Targets are considered on track when current emissions are below the linear trajectory needed to reach the defined goal.
dashboard.dataQualityExplanation: This card shows the quality of your emissions data. Primary data is direct, actual measurements, while verified data has been validated by third parties. Higher percentages of primary and verified data means greater accuracy in your emissions inventory.
dashboard.scopeBreakdownExplanation: This chart shows the distribution of your greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions by scope:
dashboard.scope1Explanation: Scope 1: Direct emissions from sources you own or control, such as combustion at facilities, company vehicles, and fugitive emissions.
dashboard.scope2Explanation: Scope 2: Indirect emissions from purchased electricity, heating, cooling, or steam consumed by your organization.
dashboard.scope3Explanation: Scope 3: All other indirect emissions occurring in your value chain, including business travel, employee commuting, purchased goods, and waste.
dashboard.emissionsTrendExplanation: This chart shows the evolution of your emissions over time, allowing you to identify trends, seasonal peaks, and the impact of your reduction initiatives. The dashed line represents future forecasts based on historical data. A downward trend indicates progress in emissions reduction.
dashboard.organizationalBoundariesExplanation: Defines the perimeter of your emissions inventory, including the consolidation approach (operational control, financial control, or equity share), included facilities, base year for comparison, and number of employees.
dashboard.sbtiProgressExplanation: Tracks progress against your Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi) validated emission reduction targets. Compares current emissions to the linear trajectory required to achieve the defined target by the target year.
dashboard.topEmittersExplanation: Identifies the main categories that contribute most to your total emissions. Focusing reduction efforts on these areas will have the greatest impact on reducing your carbon footprint.

header.title: Sustainability Overview
header.subtitle: GRI 305 ‚Ä¢ GHG Protocol ‚Ä¢ Executive summary of emissions and targets

totalEmissions.title: Total Emissions
totalEmissions.tooltip: Sum of all GHG emissions (Scope 1+2+3) in the selected period. Measured in tonnes of CO2 equivalent (tCO2e). Year-over-year change shows trend vs. previous period.

intensity.title: Intensity
intensity.tooltip: Emissions per employee (tCO2e/FTE). Efficiency metric that normalizes emissions by organization size. Enables comparison over time and with peers.

targetProgress.title: Target Progress
targetProgress.tooltip: Number of targets on track vs. total active targets. Targets are considered on track when current emissions are below the required linear trajectory.

dataQuality.title: Data Quality
dataQuality.tooltip: Percentage of primary data (direct measurements) vs. estimates. Third-party verified primary data increases reporting credibility. GRI 305, ESRS E1.

scopeBreakdown.title: Emissions by Scope
scopeBreakdown.tooltip: GHG emissions distribution by scope. Scope 1: direct emissions. Scope 2: purchased energy. Scope 3: value chain. GRI 305-1/2/3, TCFD, ESRS E1.

scope1Tooltip.title: Scope 1: Direct Emissions
scope1Tooltip.description: Direct GHG emissions from sources owned or controlled by the organization (e.g., company vehicles, on-site fuel combustion)

scope2Tooltip.title: Scope 2: Purchased Energy
scope2Tooltip.description: Indirect emissions from purchased electricity, heating, cooling, and steam. Dual reporting per GRI 305-2 & GHG Protocol.

scope3Tooltip.title: Scope 3: Value Chain Emissions
scope3Tooltip.description: All indirect emissions in value chain (upstream & downstream). Per GRI 305-3.

emissionsTrend.title: Emissions Trend & Forecast
emissionsTrend.subtitle: Historical data with ML-powered predictions
emissionsTrend.tooltip: Monthly emissions evolution by scope with ML forecast. Solid lines: actual data. Dashed lines: forecast based on historical patterns. TCFD, ESRS E1.

organizationalBoundaries.title: Organizational Boundaries
organizationalBoundaries.tooltip: Emissions reporting perimeter: consolidation, facilities, base year, and employees. GRI 2-1, GRI 2-6, GHG Protocol.

topEmitters.title: Major Emission Sources
topEmitters.tooltip: Your five largest emission sources across Scope 1, 2, and 3. Focus your reduction efforts on these categories for maximum impact. Hover over each category to see tailored recommendations.

recommendations.naturalGas: üî• Install heat pump system for efficiency

sbtiProgress.title: SBTi Target Progress
sbtiProgress.tooltip: Science Based Targets (SBTi) are emission reduction targets aligned with climate science to limit global warming to 1.5¬∞C. This tracks your progress from baseline to target year, showing actual emissions, ML forecasts, and the required reduction trajectory.

water.title: Water & Effluents
water.subtitle: GRI 303 ‚Ä¢ ESRS E3 ‚Ä¢ Water withdrawal, consumption, discharge & recycling

target.cdpDescription: Using CDP Water Security benchmark (2.5% annual)
target.initiativesSubtitle: CDP Water Security ‚Ä¢ 2.5% annual reduction ‚Ä¢ Baseline 2023

water.waterSourcesExplanation: Water withdrawal by source tracks where your organization obtains water from (municipal, groundwater, surface water, etc.). Understanding your water sources helps identify dependencies, stress levels, and opportunities for conservation or alternative sources like rainwater harvesting.
water.waterBalanceExplanation: The water balance shows the complete flow of water through your organization: withdrawal (intake), discharge (output), and consumption (water not returned). This helps identify water efficiency opportunities and compliance with GRI 303-3 and ESRS E3 standards.
water.yoyComparisonExplanation: Year-over-year comparison of water consumption shows trends and the effectiveness of water reduction initiatives. Decreasing consumption indicates successful water management, while increases may signal the need for new conservation measures.
water.waterBalanceSummaryExplanation: Water consumption is calculated as total withdrawal minus total discharge (W - D). This represents water that is not returned to local ecosystems or communities, including evaporation, incorporation into products, or consumed by humans. Per GRI 303-5, reducing consumption is critical in water-stressed areas.
water.waterReductionTargetExplanation: Water reduction targets help track progress toward conservation goals. The CDP Water Security benchmark recommends a 2.5% annual reduction in water consumption. Targets account for business growth and are measured against a baseline year to ensure continuous improvement.
water.waterInitiativesExplanation: Water management initiatives are specific actions to reduce consumption, improve efficiency, or secure alternative water sources. These can include equipment upgrades, process changes, recycling systems, or behavioral programs. Each initiative tracks estimated savings, costs, and implementation status.

explanations.sitePerformance:
Compares water intensity across different sites or facilities.

Measured in m¬≥ per square meter.

Helps identify best practices and sites needing improvement initiatives.

compliance.title: Compliance Dashboard
compliance.subtitle: GHG Protocol ‚Ä¢ GRI ‚Ä¢ ESRS E1 ‚Ä¢ TCFD

historicalNotice.title: Viewing Historical Compliance Data
historicalNotice.description: This data is read-only to maintain audit trails and data integrity. All editing capabilities are disabled for past years.

complianceStatement.title: GHG Protocol Compliance Statement
complianceStatement.defaultStatement: This inventory has been prepared in conformance with the GHG Protocol Corporate Accounting and Reporting Standard (Revised Edition). Scope 2 emissions are reported using both location-based and market-based methods as per the Scope 2 Guidance.
complianceStatement.defaultMethodology: Emissions calculated using activity-based approach with region and year-specific emission factors from DEFRA, EPA, and IEA. Scope 3 categories screened per GHG Protocol Corporate Value Chain (Scope 3) Standard.

infoBox.title: About the GHG Protocol
infoBox.description: The GHG Protocol Corporate Standard provides requirements and guidance for companies preparing a corporate-level GHG emissions inventory. It covers the accounting and reporting of seven greenhouse gases covered by the Kyoto Protocol.

waste.title: Waste & Circular Economy
waste.subtitle: GRI 306 ‚Ä¢ ESRS E5 ‚Ä¢ Waste generated, diverted from disposal & directed to disposal

monthlyByMethod.title: Monthly Waste by Disposal Method
monthlyByMethod.description: Waste hierarchy: Reduce ‚Üí Reuse ‚Üí Recycle ‚Üí Recovery ‚Üí Disposal

materialBreakdown.title: Material-Specific Breakdown
materialBreakdown.description: Recycling and diversion rates by waste material type

tooltips.wasteHierarchy: Waste Hierarchy: Prevention ‚Üí Reuse ‚Üí Recycling ‚Üí Recovery ‚Üí Disposal. Diversion rate measures waste diverted from disposal through recycling and composting.
tooltips.disposalDistribution: Waste disposal method breakdown shows how waste is managed across different treatment options. Per GRI 306-4/5, tracking diverted waste (recycling, composting) vs. disposed waste (landfill, incineration) is critical for circular economy transition and compliance with ESRS E5.
tooltips.monthlyTrends: Monthly waste generation, diversion, and emissions trends help identify seasonal patterns, operational changes, and the effectiveness of waste reduction initiatives. Per GRI 306-3, tracking these metrics is essential for managing waste impacts and improving resource efficiency.
tooltips.yoyComparison: Year-over-year comparison of waste generation shows progress toward waste reduction goals. Decreasing generation and increasing diversion rates indicate successful waste management programs. Per ESRS E5, organizations should demonstrate continuous improvement in waste performance.
tooltips.circularEconomy: Circular economy metrics track how effectively waste is kept in productive use. Diversion rate (% diverted from disposal) and recycling rate (% recycled) are key performance indicators. The waste hierarchy prioritizes prevention, reuse, and recycling over disposal.
tooltips.sbtiProgress: Science Based Targets (SBTi) for waste aim to reduce Scope 3 emissions from waste disposal by 4.2% annually, aligned with a 1.5¬∞C warming pathway. Progress is tracked against baseline year emissions, with targets adjusted for business growth.
tooltips.materialBreakdown: Material-specific tracking shows recycling and diversion rates by waste type (paper, plastic, metal, etc.). This granular data helps identify improvement opportunities and ensures compliance with extended producer responsibility regulations.
tooltips.emissionsTooltip: Scope 3 emissions from waste disposal, including landfill methane, incineration CO2, and transportation. Lower emissions indicate better waste management and higher diversion rates.
tooltips.intensityTooltip: Emissions intensity per ton of waste generated (tCO2e/t). Lower intensity indicates more efficient waste management and higher diversion to low-emission methods like recycling and composting.
tooltips.disposalPieTooltip: Breakdown of waste by disposal method, showing the proportion sent to each treatment pathway. Prioritize waste hierarchy: reduce, reuse, recycle, recover, then dispose.
tooltips.monthlyTrendsTooltip: Monthly trends in waste generation, diversion, and emissions with ML-powered forecasting. Monitor progress toward circular economy goals and identify seasonal patterns.
tooltips.yoyComparisonTooltip: Year-over-year comparison of waste generation showing percentage changes. Track performance improvements and identify trends across reporting periods.
tooltips.circularEconomyTooltip: Key circular economy indicators: diversion rate, recycling rate, landfill percentage, and Scope 3 emissions. These metrics track progress toward zero waste and circular business models.
tooltips.monthlyByMethodTooltip: Monthly breakdown by disposal method following the waste hierarchy. Prioritize reduction at source, then reuse, recycling, recovery, and finally disposal.
tooltips.sbtiProgressTooltip: Science-Based Targets initiative (SBTi) waste reduction progress aligned with 1.5¬∞C pathway. Tracks annual 4.2% reduction in waste-related emissions toward 2030 targets.
tooltips.materialBreakdownTooltip: Waste performance by material type showing recycling and diversion rates. Identify material-specific improvement opportunities and track circular economy progress.

insights.title: Material Insights:
insights.description: Track recycling and diversion rates by specific material types. Historical data (2022-2024) has been split using industry-standard composition ratios. Future data can be entered at the material level for precise tracking.

explanations.sitePerformance:
Compares waste generation intensity across different sites or facilities.

Measured in kg per square meter.

Helps identify best practices and sites needing improvement initiatives.

dataInvestigation.title: Data Investigation
dataInvestigation.subtitle: Detailed monthly breakdown of all sustainability metrics
dataInvestigation.anomaliesFound: The following anomalies were found in the {year} data:
dataInvestigation.noteOctoberMarch: Note: It appears that October data may have been incorrectly recorded as March, resulting in duplicate March entries and missing October data.
dataInvestigation.noData: No data available for the selected period.

ghgEmissions.title: GHG Emissions
ghgEmissions.subtitle: GHG Protocol ‚Ä¢ GRI 305 ‚Ä¢ ESRS E1 ‚Ä¢ TCFD

intensityMetrics.title: Emissions Intensity Metrics
intensityMetrics.tooltip: Intensity metrics normalize emissions by different denominators to enable benchmarking and tracking efficiency improvements over time.

perOperatingHour.title: Per Operating Hour
perOperatingHour.subtitle: Operational efficiency
perOperatingHour.tooltip: Emissions per operating hour helps track the efficiency of your operations and identify optimization opportunities during different operational periods.

perCustomer.title: Per Customer
perCustomer.subtitle: Service efficiency
perCustomer.tooltip: Emissions per customer helps service-based organizations track their carbon footprint per service unit delivered.

sectorSpecific.title: Production-Based
sectorSpecific.tooltip: Industry-specific intensity metric based on your organization's sector. Allows direct comparison with peers in the same industry.

sitePerformance.title: Site Emissions Ranking
sitePerformance.subtitle: Intensity per m¬≤
sitePerformance.tooltip: Sites are ranked by emissions intensity (kgCO2e/m¬≤). Lower intensity indicates better energy efficiency and emissions performance per unit area.

recommendations.naturalGas: üî• Install heat pump or upgrade boilers

scope1Breakdown.title: Scope 1 Breakdown
scope1Breakdown.explanation:
Detailed breakdown of Scope 1 direct emissions by source category.

Includes stationary combustion (facilities, boilers), mobile combustion (company vehicles), and fugitive emissions (leaks, refrigerants).

Prioritize the largest sources for reduction initiatives.

scope2Breakdown.title: Scope 2 Breakdown

tooltip.title: GHG Protocol Dual Reporting

locationBased.title: Location-Based Method
locationBased.description: Uses average emission factors for the local electricity grid. Reflects regional energy mix and grid infrastructure.

marketBased.title: Market-Based Method
marketBased.description: Uses emission factors from contractual instruments (RECs, GOs, PPAs). Reflects your energy purchasing choices and renewable commitments.

tooltip.footer: GRI 305-2 requires reporting both methods for complete transparency.

scope2Breakdown.explanation:
Detailed breakdown of Scope 2 indirect emissions from purchased energy. GRI 305-2 requires dual reporting for complete transparency:

‚Ä¢ Location-Based Method: Uses average emission factors for the local electricity grid. Reflects regional energy mix and grid infrastructure.

‚Ä¢ Market-Based Method: Uses emission factors from contractual instruments (RECs, GOs, PPAs). Reflects your energy purchasing choices and renewable commitments.

Renewable energy purchases reduce market-based emissions while location-based remains tied to the grid average.

scope3Breakdown.title: Scope 3 Breakdown

valueChainCoverage.title: Value Chain Coverage

tooltip.title: Scope 3: Value Chain Emissions (15 Categories)
tooltip.description: Scope 3 covers all indirect emissions in your value chain, from suppliers to end-users. The GHG Protocol defines 15 categories across upstream and downstream activities.

upstream.title: Upstream (8 categories):
upstream.items: Purchased goods, capital goods, fuel & energy, transportation, waste, business travel, commuting, leased assets

downstream.title: Downstream (7 categories):
downstream.items: Transportation, processing, use of products, end-of-life, leased assets, franchises, investments

tooltip.footer: GRI 305-3 requires disclosure of significant Scope 3 categories. Aim for 80%+ coverage.

valueChainCoverage.lowCoverage: ‚ö†Ô∏è Low coverage - expand tracking to key categories

scope3Breakdown.explanation:
Detailed breakdown of Scope 3 value chain emissions across 15 GHG Protocol categories.

Includes upstream (suppliers, purchased goods, business travel) and downstream (product use, end-of-life) emissions.

GRI 305-3 requires reporting significant categories.

Target 80%+ coverage for comprehensive carbon footprint.

explanations.scopeBreakdown:
This chart shows the distribution of your greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions by scope:

‚Ä¢ Scope 1: Direct emissions from sources you own or control, such as combustion at facilities, company vehicles, and fugitive emissions.

‚Ä¢ Scope 2: Indirect emissions from purchased electricity, heating, cooling, or steam consumed by your organization.

‚Ä¢ Scope 3: All other indirect emissions occurring in your value chain, including business travel, employee commuting, purchased goods, and waste.
explanations.scope1: Scope 1: Direct emissions from sources you own or control, such as combustion at facilities, company vehicles, and fugitive emissions.
explanations.scope2: Scope 2: Indirect emissions from purchased electricity, heating, cooling, or steam consumed by your organization.
explanations.scope3: Scope 3: All other indirect emissions occurring in your value chain, including business travel, employee commuting, purchased goods, and waste.
explanations.emissionsTrend:
This chart shows the evolution of your emissions over time, allowing you to identify trends, seasonal peaks, and the impact of your reduction initiatives.

The dashed line represents future forecasts based on historical data.

A downward trend indicates progress in emissions reduction.
explanations.topEmitters:
Identifies the main categories that contribute most to your total emissions.

Focusing reduction efforts on these areas will have the greatest impact on reducing your carbon footprint.
explanations.sbtiProgress:
Tracks progress against your Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi) validated emission reduction targets.

Compares current emissions to the linear trajectory required to achieve the defined target by the target year.
explanations.totalEmissions:
Total organizational greenhouse gas emissions across all three scopes.

Includes year-over-year comparison and ML-based annual projection.

Decreases indicate successful emission reduction initiatives.
explanations.intensity:
Emissions intensity per full-time equivalent employee (FTE).

Key performance indicator for tracking emissions efficiency as your organization grows.

Lower values indicate better carbon efficiency per employee.
explanations.scope3Coverage:
Tracks coverage of the 15 Scope 3 value chain emission categories defined by the GHG Protocol.

GRI 305-3 requires reporting all significant categories.

Target: 80%+ coverage for comprehensive carbon footprint accounting.
explanations.dataQuality:
Measures the proportion of emissions data from primary sources (actual measurements) versus secondary sources (estimates and factors).

Higher primary data percentage improves accuracy and credibility.

Third-party verification enhances stakeholder confidence.
explanations.yoyComparison:
Month-by-month comparison against the same period last year.

Helps identify seasonal patterns and track progress.

Positive changes indicate increases, negative changes indicate reductions.
explanations.sitePerformance:
Compares emission intensity across different sites or facilities.

Measured in kgCO2e per square meter.

Helps identify best practices and sites needing improvement initiatives.
explanations.organizationalBoundariesExplanation: Defines the perimeter of your emissions inventory, including the consolidation approach (operational control, financial control, or equity share), included facilities, base year for comparison, and number of employees.

organizationalBoundaries.title: Organizational Boundaries
organizationalBoundaries.tooltip: Emissions reporting perimeter: consolidation, facilities, base year, and employees. GRI 2-1, GRI 2-6, GHG Protocol.

performanceIndex.title: blipee Performance Index‚Ñ¢
performanceIndex.subtitle: Portfolio-wide sustainability performance across all sites

tooltip.title: About the Performance Index
tooltip.description: A comprehensive sustainability score (0-100) that measures your environmental performance across multiple categories. Combines energy, water, waste, transportation, and compliance metrics into a single actionable indicator.

howCalculated.title: How It's Calculated
howCalculated.description: The index aggregates weighted categories based on industry materiality, data quality, and peer benchmarking. Higher scores indicate better sustainability performance.

improvingScore.title: Improving your score
improvingScore.description: Focus on high-weight categories first. Use the detailed metrics below to identify areas for improvement and track your progress over time.

whyMatters.title: Why It Matters
whyMatters.description: Enables tracking progress over time, comparing across sites, and identifying priority improvement areas. The trend shows whether performance is improving or declining.

tooltip.footer: Aligned with GRI, ESRS, and leading sustainability frameworks

tooltip.title: Understanding Category Scores
tooltip.description: Each category contributes to your overall score based on its weight and relevance to your organization. Categories are ordered by impact, showing the most important ones first.

columns.title: What the columns mean:
columns.trend: Direction of change over time (improving ‚Üë / stable ‚Üí / declining ‚Üì)

improving.title: How to Improve:
improving.description: Focus on the highest-weighted categories first. Use trends to track progress. Percentiles help you benchmark against peers and set realistic goals.

tooltip.title: Site Performance Ranking
tooltip.description: Sites ranked by their blipee Performance Index‚Ñ¢ score (0-100), where higher scores indicate better overall sustainability performance. Top 3 performers are highlighted with medals. Use this ranking to identify best practices and share learnings across sites.

emptyState.title: Ready to Calculate Your Performance Score
emptyState.portfolioDescription: Calculate your portfolio-wide blipee Performance Index. The system will analyze all available data across your sites and provide a comprehensive sustainability score.
emptyState.siteDescription: Calculate your blipee Performance Index to see your sustainability score. The system will work with whatever data you have available.
emptyState.adaptiveNote: Don't worry if you don't have all data - the score adapts to what's available
emptyState.worksWith: Works with any amount of data ‚Ä¢ Instant calculation

energy.title: Energy Management
energy.subtitle: GRI 302 ‚Ä¢ ESRS E1-5 ‚Ä¢ Energy consumption and intensity tracking

totalEnergy.title: Total Energy
totalEnergy.explanation: Sum of all energy consumed across all sources in the selected period. Measured in megawatt-hours (MWh). Year-over-year change shows consumption trend compared to the previous period.

renewable.title: Renewable
renewable.explanation: Percentage of total energy consumption from renewable sources (solar, wind, hydro, etc.). Higher renewable percentage indicates progress toward clean energy transition and lower carbon emissions.

emissions.title: Emissions
emissions.explanation: Total greenhouse gas emissions from energy consumption in tonnes of CO2 equivalent (tCO2e). Calculated using emission factors for each energy source type.

intensity.title: Intensity
intensity.explanation: Energy consumed per square meter of building space (kWh/m¬≤). This metric normalizes energy use by facility size, enabling comparison across different periods and buildings.

sourcesDistribution.title: Energy Sources Breakdown
sourcesDistribution.explanation: Breakdown of energy consumption by source type. Shows the proportion of each energy source in your total energy mix, helping identify opportunities for renewable energy adoption.

sourcesBreakdown.title: Energy Sources Breakdown
sourcesBreakdown.subtitle: Detailed breakdown by category, subcategory, and metric

monthlyEvolution.title: Monthly Evolution
monthlyEvolution.explanation: Monthly energy consumption trends over time, including ML forecast for remaining months. The dashed line represents forecasted consumption based on historical patterns and seasonality.
monthlyEvolution.description: Showing total, renewable, and fossil fuel consumption

yoyComparison.title: Year-over-Year Variation
yoyComparison.explanation: Monthly percentage change in energy consumption compared to the same month in the previous year. Positive values indicate increased consumption, negative values show reduction.
yoyComparison.description: Monthly change compared to previous year

gridMix.title: Electricity Grid Mix
gridMix.explanation: Composition of the electrical grid powering your facilities, showing the breakdown of renewable and fossil fuel sources. This data helps calculate Scope 2 and Scope 3.3 emissions accurately.

typeBreakdown.title: Energy Type Breakdown
typeBreakdown.explanation: Energy consumption categorized by type (electricity, heating, cooling, etc.). This breakdown helps identify where energy is being used and prioritize efficiency improvements.

target.title: Energy Reduction Targets
target.description: Track progress toward SBTi-aligned emission reduction goals

gridMix.renewableNote: Applies to grid electricity. Total emissions factor considered:
gridMix.detailedBreakdownUnavailable: Detailed source breakdown not yet available
gridMix.applyMigrations: Apply migrations to see Wind, Solar, Hydro, Gas, Coal breakdown
gridMix.someSourcesUnknown: Some energy sources are unknown. Contact your supplier for complete mix data.

charts2.noMonthlyData: No monthly data available for the selected period
charts2.stackedBreakdownDescription: Stacked breakdown of monthly energy consumption by source, showing contribution of each energy type to total consumption over time.

forecast.includesMLForecast: Includes ML forecast for {count} remaining months
forecast.renewableForecastZero: (Renewable forecast: 0 MWh - based on historical trend)

sbti.title: SBTi Target Progress
sbti.description: Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi) progress tracking for energy-related emissions. Shows annual reduction targets aligned with 1.5¬∞C pathway to limit global warming.

allocationReasons.highRenewableEfficiency: High: renewable energy, efficiency, on-site generation
allocationReasons.highRenewableProcurement: High: renewable procurement, grid mix improvement, PPAs
allocationReasons.lowBaselineOptimized: Low: baseline optimized, limited reduction potential

explanations.sitePerformance:
Compares energy intensity across different sites or facilities.

Measured in kWh per square meter.

Helps identify best practices and sites needing improvement initiatives.

whatIsCO2e.heading: What is CO2e?
whatIsCO2e.content: CO2e (Carbon Dioxide Equivalent) is a standard unit for measuring carbon footprints. It expresses the impact of different greenhouse gases in terms of the equivalent amount of CO2.

oneTonne.heading: What does 1 tonne of CO2e look like?
oneTonne.content: Abstract numbers are hard to visualize. Here are some real-world comparisons:

whyMeasure.heading: Why measure in CO2e?
whyMeasure.content: Using CO2e allows us to add up all greenhouse gas emissions into one number, making it easier to track progress and set targets.

comparisons.driving: Driving 2,500 km in a gasoline car
comparisons.trees: What 1.15 trees absorb in a year

whatAreScopes.heading: What are Scopes?
whatAreScopes.content: The GHG Protocol divides emissions into 3 'scopes' to help organizations understand where their emissions come from.

scope1.heading: Scope 1: Direct Emissions
scope1.content: Emissions from sources that your organization owns or directly controls.

scope2.heading: Scope 2: Indirect Energy Emissions
scope2.content: Emissions from the generation of purchased energy (electricity, heating, cooling).

scope3.heading: Scope 3: Value Chain Emissions
scope3.content: All other indirect emissions in your value chain. Often 70-80% of a company's total footprint.

parisAgreement.heading: The 1.5¬∞C Target
parisAgreement.content: The Paris Agreement aims to limit global warming to 1.5¬∞C above pre-industrial levels to avoid catastrophic climate impacts.

warmingLevels.heading: What happens at different warming levels?
warmingLevels.content: Every fraction of a degree matters:

goodNews.heading: The Good News
goodNews.content: We have the technology and knowledge to solve this. Renewable energy is now cheaper than fossil fuels.

warming.oneFiveDesc: Severe impacts, but manageable with adaptation
warming.twoDesc: Significantly worse: more extreme heat, droughts, floods

highImpact.heading: Focus on High-Impact Actions
highImpact.content: Not all emission reduction actions are equal. Focus on these:

hierarchy.heading: The Reduction Hierarchy
hierarchy.content: Always follow this order: 1) Avoid/Reduce first, 2) Switch to low-carbon alternatives, 3) Offset only as last resort.

whatIsSBTi.heading: What are Science-Based Targets?
whatIsSBTi.content: Emission reduction goals aligned with climate science - specifically, what's needed to limit warming to 1.5¬∞C.

whyImportant.heading: Why are they important?
whyImportant.content: SBTi targets give you credibility. Over 4,000 companies worldwide have committed to SBTi targets.

types.heading: Types of SBTi Targets
types.content: There are different target types based on timeframe and ambition:

howToStart.heading: How to get started
howToStart.content: Start by measuring your baseline emissions (you're already doing this!). Then submit your targets to SBTi for validation.

smartphone.context: Charging your phone fully uses about 0.008 kg CO2e per charge
smartphone.didYouKnow: One full charge = watching 2 hours of Netflix on your phone!

coffee.context: Making coffee (beans, water heating, milk) ‚âà 1.25 kg CO2e per cup
coffee.didYouKnow: The milk in your latte creates more emissions than the coffee beans!

burger.context: One beef burger creates ~10 kg CO2e (farm to plate)
burger.didYouKnow: A plant-based burger creates 90% less emissions!

shower.context: Heating water for a shower uses ~20 kg CO2e
shower.didYouKnow: Reducing shower time by 2 minutes saves 10 kg CO2e per month!

matureTree.format: {n} mature trees absorbing CO2 for 1 year
matureTree.format_one: {n} mature tree absorbing CO2 for 1 year
matureTree.context: One mature tree absorbs ~21 kg CO2e per year through photosynthesis
matureTree.didYouKnow: It takes a tree 20+ years to become a "mature" carbon absorber!

seedling.context: Young trees absorb less CO2 initially but more as they grow
seedling.didYouKnow: A growing forest absorbs 2-3√ó more CO2 than a mature forest!

grassland.context: Grasslands absorb ~2.5 tonnes CO2e per hectare annually
grassland.didYouKnow: Grasslands store more carbon in their roots than trees do!

oceanAlgae.format: {n} hectares of ocean algae for 1 year
oceanAlgae.format_one: {n} hectare of ocean algae for 1 year
oceanAlgae.context: Ocean phytoplankton absorbs ~2 tonnes CO2e per hectare
oceanAlgae.didYouKnow: Oceans absorb 25% of all human CO2 emissions every year!

driving.context: Average car emits ~0.4 kg CO2e per km
driving.didYouKnow: Taking the train instead reduces emissions by 80%!

lisbonAlgarve.didYouKnow: Carpooling with 3 friends makes this 75% more efficient!

scooter.context: Scooters emit half the CO2 of cars per km
scooter.didYouKnow: Electric scooters emit 90% less than gas scooters!

driving.context: Average car emits ~0.4 kg CO2e per km
driving.didYouKnow: The AVE high-speed train uses 85% less emissions!

madridValencia.didYouKnow: Spanish trains run on 60% renewable energy!

driving.context: Average car: 0.4 kg CO2e per km
driving.didYouKnow: EVs reduce this by 70% (depending on electricity source)!

lisbonParis.didYouKnow: 8 hours on a train creates 95% less emissions than this flight!

lisbonLondon.didYouKnow: Business class seats create 3√ó more emissions (take up more space)!

lisbonRome.didYouKnow: Planes are 5-10√ó more polluting per km than trains!

madridLondon.didYouKnow: A video call eliminates this emission entirely!

regionalFlight.didYouKnow: Aviation creates 2.5% of global CO2 emissions!

electricity.context: Average home: ~10 tonnes CO2e per year from electricity
electricity.didYouKnow: Switching to LED bulbs saves 80 kg CO2e per bulb per year!

hvac.context: HVAC is typically 40% of home energy use
hvac.didYouKnow: A smart thermostat can reduce this by 15-20%!

gasHeating.context: Gas heating: ~3.5 tonnes CO2e per year
gasHeating.didYouKnow: Heat pumps use 3√ó less energy than gas heating!

airConditioning.context: AC can use 20-50 kg CO2e per month in summer
airConditioning.didYouKnow: Raising AC temp by 1¬∞C saves 7% energy!

treesYear.format: {n} mature trees absorbing CO2 for 1 year
treesYear.format_one: {n} mature tree absorbing CO2 for 1 year
treesYear.context: One mature tree absorbs ~0.87 tonnes CO2e per year through photosynthesis
treesYear.didYouKnow: It takes a tree 20+ years to become a "mature" carbon absorber!

factoryMonths.format: {n} months of a small factory's emissions
factoryMonths.format_one: {n} month of a small factory's emissions
factoryMonths.context: Small manufacturing: ~1000 tonnes CO2e per year (83 tonnes/month)
factoryMonths.didYouKnow: This is why industrial efficiency is so critical!

peopleYearly.context: Global average: ~4 tonnes CO2e per person per year
peopleYearly.didYouKnow: US average is 16 tonnes, India is 1.9 tonnes per person!

transatlanticFlights.context: Long-haul flight: ~4 tonnes CO2e per passenger round-trip
transatlanticFlights.didYouKnow: One long-haul flight = a year of driving for many people!

arcticIce.format: {n} m¬≤ of Arctic sea ice melted
arcticIce.context: Each tonne of CO2 melts ~3 m¬≤ of Arctic summer sea ice
arcticIce.didYouKnow: Arctic sea ice has declined 13% per decade since 1979!

seaLevel.format: {n} mm of global sea level rise
seaLevel.format_less_than_one: < 1 mm of global sea level rise
seaLevel.context: Every 1000 tonnes CO2e contributes to 0.32 mm sea level rise
seaLevel.didYouKnow: Sea levels are rising 3.4 mm per year - 2√ó faster than 50 years ago!

globalWarming.format: {n} millionths of a degree of global warming
globalWarming.context: Every tonne of CO2e contributes ~0.00015 millionths ¬∞C warming
globalWarming.didYouKnow: We've already warmed 1.1¬∞C since pre-industrial times - every fraction matters!

polarBearHabitat.format: {n} days of polar bear habitat loss
polarBearHabitat.format_one: {n} day of polar bear habitat loss
polarBearHabitat.context: Arctic ice loss = ~1 day per 15 tonnes CO2e
polarBearHabitat.didYouKnow: Polar bears need sea ice to hunt - they're losing 3-4 weeks of hunting time per decade!

hero.title: Building Tomorrow's Sustainable
hero.subtitle: We're on a mission to make sustainability profitable, measurable, and accessible to every business through AI innovation.

story.title: Our
story.paragraph1: blipee was born from a simple yet powerful observation: businesses want to be sustainable, but they lack the time, expertise, and resources to do it effectively. Traditional sustainability consulting is expensive and time-consuming. We knew there had to be a better way.
story.paragraph2: Our founders ‚Äì a unique blend of AI researchers, environmental scientists, and business strategists ‚Äì came together to build something unprecedented: an autonomous AI workforce dedicated entirely to sustainability. Each of our 8 agents is trained on millions of data points, working 24/7 to optimize every aspect of your operations.
story.paragraph3: Today, blipee represents the convergence of cutting-edge artificial intelligence and urgent environmental action. We're not just a software platform ‚Äì we're your sustainability team, scaled infinitely and always available.

vision.title: The Vision
vision.description: Founded by a team of AI researchers and sustainability experts who believed business could be a force for environmental good.

firstAgents.title: First Agents Deployed
firstAgents.description: Launched our first 3 AI agents focusing on ESG compliance, carbon tracking, and supply chain optimization.

completeWorkforce.title: Complete AI Workforce
completeWorkforce.description: Expanded to 8 specialized agents covering all aspects of sustainable operations, from maintenance to regulatory compliance.

cta.title: Join Our
cta.text: Be part of the team that's redefining how businesses approach sustainability.

hero.title: Pioneering the Future of
hero.subtitle: We're building the world's most advanced AI workforce dedicated to sustainability and operational excellence.

mission.title: Our
mission.paragraph1: At blipee, we believe that every business can be a force for good. Our mission is to make sustainability accessible, measurable, and profitable for companies of all sizes through the power of autonomous AI agents.
mission.paragraph2: We've assembled 8 specialized AI agents that work 24/7, each an expert in a critical aspect of sustainable operations. From ESG compliance to carbon tracking, from supply chain optimization to cost savings ‚Äì we cover it all with unprecedented accuracy and intelligence.

innovation.title: Innovation
innovation.description: We leverage cutting-edge AI to solve sustainability challenges that matter.

commitment.title: 24/7 Commitment
commitment.description: Our AI agents work around the clock, ensuring your sustainability goals never sleep.

trust.title: Trust & Transparency
trust.description: We build trust through transparent processes and verifiable results.

impact.title: Impact
impact.description: Every action we take is measured by its real-world environmental and business impact.

cta.title: Join Our
cta.text: We're always looking for talented individuals who share our passion for sustainability and innovation.

hero.title: Build the Future of
hero.subtitle: Join a team of innovators working to make sustainability accessible, measurable, and profitable for every business.

cuttingEdge.title: Cutting-Edge AI
cuttingEdge.description: Work with state-of-the-art AI models and contribute to groundbreaking sustainability solutions.

realImpact.title: Real Impact
realImpact.description: Every line of code you write helps businesses reduce their environmental footprint.

remoteFirst.title: Remote-First
remoteFirst.description: Work from anywhere in the world. We value results over location.

growth.title: Growth & Learning
growth.description: Continuous learning budget, conferences, and mentorship programs.

compensation.title: Competitive Package
compensation.description: Top-tier salary, equity options, and comprehensive benefits.

wellness.title: Wellness Support
wellness.description: Health insurance, mental wellness programs, and unlimited PTO.

seniorAI.title: Senior AI Engineer
seniorAI.description: Lead the development of our autonomous AI agents. Design and implement machine learning models that drive sustainability insights.

fullStack.title: Full-Stack Engineer
fullStack.description: Build beautiful, performant interfaces that make sustainability data actionable. Work across our Next.js frontend and Node.js backend.

productDesigner.title: Product Designer
productDesigner.description: Craft intuitive experiences that make complex sustainability metrics understandable. Own the entire design system.

sustainability.title: Sustainability Specialist
sustainability.description: Bridge the gap between AI capabilities and real-world sustainability practices. Help shape our agent expertise.

cta.title: Don't See Your
cta.text: We're always looking for exceptional talent. Send us your resume and tell us how you can help build the future of sustainable business.

hero.title: Get in
hero.subtitle: Have questions? We'd love to hear from you. Send us a message and we'll respond as soon as possible.

info.title: Let's Talk
info.description: Whether you're interested in our AI workforce, have questions about sustainability, or want to explore a partnership, we're here to help.

meeting.title: Schedule a Meeting
meeting.description: Book a time that works for you

carbonDashboard.title: Carbon Dashboard
carbonDashboard.subtitle: Track and reduce carbon emissions across your organization
